intro: Phymatodes cuspidata monstr. dichotoma, commonly known as the dichotomous phymatodes, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its distinctive dichotomous branching pattern, where each stem splits into two equal branches. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, often with a slight curl. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
